text: {| |} HMS Redbreast was a passenger/cargo ship requisitioned by the British Government during World War I, and used as a messager ship and antisubmarine Q-ship. She was torpedoed and sunk by the Imperial German Navy submarine UC-38 in the Aegean Sea on 15 July 1917 while on passage from Skyros to the Doro Channel. Forty-two of her crew were killed. ==References== Category:Ships built on the River Clyde Category:1908 ships Category:Q-ships of the Royal Navy Category:Maritime incidents in 1917 Category:Ships sunk by German submarines in World War I Category:World War I shipwrecks in the Aegean Sea
title: HMS Redbreast (1915)
